raw_text:
Wenger rules out new keeper
 
 Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger says he has no plans to sign a new goalkeeper during the January transfer window.
 
 Wenger has brought in Manuel Almunia for the last three games for the out-of-form Jens Lehmann - but the Spaniard himself has been prone to mistakes. There have been suggestions that Wenger will swoop for a high-quality shot-stopper in the New Year. But he told the Evening Standard: "I don't feel it will be necessary to bring in a new goalkeeper in January." The Gunners manager refused to comment on the difficult start that 27-year-old Almunia has made to his career at Highbury. And he would not be drawn on whether Lehmann would return for the top-of-the table clash with Chelsea on Sunday.
 
 Almunia was at fault for Rosenborg's goal in Arsenal's 5-1 Champions League win on Tuesday and had some hairy moments in last week's win over Birmingham. But Wenger said earlier this week that his indifferent form was down to pressure caused by being under scrutiny from the media. "The debate has gone on too long. Everyone has an opinion and I do not have to add to it," Wenger added. Arsenal have been linked with Middlesbrough keeper Mark Schwarzer, Fulham's Edwin van der Sar and Parma's Sebastien Frey. And Wenger has no immediate plans to recall former England Under-21 international Stuart Taylor from his loan spell at Leicester.
llama3.2:1b: Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger says he does not plan to sign a new goalkeeper during the January transfer window, despite bringing in Manuel Almunia for three games due to Jens Lehmann's struggles.
llama3.2:3b: Arsene Wenger rules out signing a new goalkeeper in January transfer window, despite Jens Lehmann's form issues and Manuel Almunia's mistakes.

He believes Almunia is the best option, despite some recent errors.
He refused to comment on Lehmann's return for Chelsea and defended Almunia against media scrutiny.
Arsenal have been linked with several goalkeepers but there are no immediate plans to recall Stuart Taylor.

Wenger told the Evening Standard that he doesn't feel it's necessary to bring in a new goalkeeper in January.
The Gunners refused to comment on any difficult start to 27-year-old Almunia at Arsenal, and were not drawn on whether Jens Lehmann would return for the top-of-the-table clash with Chelsea on Sunday.

Almunia was at fault for Rosenborg's goal against Arsenal in their Champions League win, had some hairy moments in last week's game with Birmingham, but Wenger said his indifferent form is down to being under pressure from media scrutiny.

Wenger does not feel it necessary and did not comment on Almunia's career start or Lehmann's return for a key match against Chelsea.
He cited media scrutiny as a reason for Almunia's poor form.

Arsenal have been linked with Middlesbrough's Mark Schwarzer, Fulham's Edwin van der Sar, and Parma's Sebastien Frey, but Wenger has no immediate plans to recall former England Under-21 international Stuart Taylor from his loan at Leicester.
